benchmark_details.name: BackFed (Benchmark Suite for Backdoor Attacks in Federated Learning)
benchmark_details.overview: BackFed is a comprehensive benchmark suite designed to standardize, streamline, and reliably evaluate backdoor attacks and defenses in Federated Learning (FL), focusing on practical constraints.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To standardize evaluations of backdoor attacks and defenses in Federated Learning.

data.source: CIFAR-10, MNIST, FEMNIST, Sentiment140, Reddit Corpus
data.size: 805,263 samples for FEMNIST, 1,600,498 samples for Sentiment140
data.format: Various formats including image datasets and text
data.annotation: Dataset partitioning simulated among clients using Dirichlet and uniform distributions, including artificial simulation of dataset partitioning.

methodology.calculation: Evaluation metrics calculated across communication rounds after training completion.
methodology.interpretation: Higher values of ASR indicate more effective attacks; Lifespan measures persistence of the backdoor.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparison made against existing frameworks like FLPoison.
